result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Renee Smart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lisa Renee Smart in court with attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to amend to misd. 961.41(3g)(e) possession of THC - state will file an amended information after the hearing.  Court grants motion to amend to 961.41(3g)(e).     DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DE entered plea of Nc.  Court finds DE guilty count 1. 


Court sentence w/held probation 1 year and costs $443.00 -   any counseling DOC may recommend

Defendant Lisa Renee Smart in court with attorney T. Gregory Amann.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  10:03 AM Court calls case.  State addressed the Court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 1, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney T Gregory Amann appeared by phone means for Defendant Lisa Renee Smart. Prosecuting Atty Aaron B Marcoux appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Lisa Renee Smart in court.
Atty Amann made request for suppression hearing.  Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 09:30 am.

  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Lisa Renee Smart in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  11:24 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.
